intro: Coelidium euchaetioides, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant features a branched stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbels, giving it a delicate appearance. Coelidium euchaetioides is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
